title: (Pwn2Own) Inductive Automation Ignition ServerMessageHeader Deserialization Of Untrusted Data Remote Code Execution Vulnerability
description:
This vulnerability allows remote attackers to execute arbitrary code on affected installations of Inductive Automation Ignition.  Authentication is not required to exploit this vulnerability.
The specific flaw exists with the handling of serialized data.  The issue results from the lack of proper validation of user-supplied data, which can result in deserialization of untrusted data. An attacker can leverage this vulnerability to execute code in the context of SYSTEM.
timeline:
2020-01-30 - Vulnerability reported to vendor
2020-06-01 - Coordinated public release of advisory
credit: Chris Anastasio (muffin) and Steven Seeley (mr_me) of Incite Team
